items: Adjust the cable machine to the appropriate weight and attach the rope handle to the cable.
Sit on the bench with your feet flat on the floor and your knees bent.
Grasp the rope handle with both hands, palms facing each other.
Keep your back straight and your shoulders relaxed.
Begin the exercise by pulling the rope towards your body, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement.
Slowly release the rope back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Targets multiple muscle groups including the back, shoulders, and arms
Improves posture and spinal alignment
Increases overall strength and muscle endurance
Allows for a greater range of motion compared to traditional seated rows
Can be easily modified to target specific areas of the back or shoulders
Rhomboids
Trapezius
Erector Spinae
Biceps
Forearms
Close-grip cable rope seated row
Wide-grip cable rope seated row
Reverse-grip cable rope seated row
